references.paper_title: On the Bottleneck of Graph Neural Networks and its Practical Implications
references.reason: This paper analyzes the limitations of Graph Neural Networks, providing a foundation for the development of improved methods like the one proposed in this paper.

references.paper_title: Specformer: Spectral Graph Neural Networks Meet Transformers
references.reason: This paper combines spectral graph neural networks and transformers for node classification, directly inspiring the architecture of the proposed method.

references.paper_title: Measuring and Relieving the Over-Smoothing Problem for Graph Neural Networks from the Topological View
references.reason: This paper addresses the over-smoothing problem in GNNs, a challenge that is also relevant to the proposed graph transformer method.

references.paper_title: NAGphormer: A Tokenized Graph Transformer for Node Classification in Large Graphs
references.reason: This paper introduces a tokenized graph transformer, similar to the proposed method but without contrastive learning, providing a baseline for comparison and highlighting the improvement offered by the novel method.

references.paper_title: Representing Long-Range Context for Graph Neural Networks with Global Attention
references.reason: This paper addresses the challenge of capturing long-range dependencies in graphs, which is crucial for the effective performance of graph transformers, especially for node classification.
